passage: Enrico Fermi, an Italian physicist, was known for his ability to make rough estimates and calculations with remarkable accuracy. This skill led to the development of the "Fermi problem," a type of problem-solving that requires making educated guesses based on limited information. Fermi's approach to problem-solving has inspired many scientists and mathematicians to embrace uncertainty and develop their own intuitive sense of estimation.
question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

choices.A: The text describes Enrico Fermi's personal life and how it influenced his approach to problem-solving.
choices.B: The text highlights Enrico Fermi's estimation skills and the influence of Fermi problems on scientific thinking.
choices.C: The text focuses on the history of Fermi problems and their development over time.
choices.D: The text explores various techniques used by scientists to solve Fermi problems.
